docs.lead_paragraph: The 40 million Americans who receive Social Security benefits will get a 3.7 percent increase starting in January, the Government announced today. That is the smallest cost-of-living adjustment in five years. The increase, while smaller than those allowed from 1988 through this year, is larger than the increases from 1984 through 1987.

headline.main: Social Security Benefits to Go Up 3.7%

docs.snippet: The 40 million Americans who receive Social Security benefits will get a 3.7 percent increase starting in January, the Government announced today. That is the smallest cost-of-living adjustment in five years.    The increase, while smaller than those...

docs.lead_paragraph: Persistent infection with a common spiral-shaped bacterium greatly increases the risk of stomach cancer, two new studies have concluded. Stomach cancer is the second most-common cancer in the world, after lung cancer.

headline.main: Stomach Cancer Is Linked to Persistent Infection With a Common Bacterium

docs.snippet: Persistent infection with a common spiral-shaped bacterium greatly increases the risk of stomach cancer, two new studies have concluded.   Stomach cancer is the second most-common cancer in the world, after lung cancer.
